[1] Due to the lack of availability of agonists and antagonists selective for the different adenylate cyclase isoforms, we took advantage of recent reports which showed that AC5 and 6 can be differentiated functionally from other isoforms based on the fact that their activities are reduced by both PKA activation and increases in intracellular calcium. [2] 8-Br-cAMP was added as an activator of PKA and carbachol was used to increase intracellular calcium. [3] There was a significant decrease in the Isc response to forskolin when tissues were costimulated with 10 Î¼M forskolin and either 10 Î¼M 8-Br-cAMP or 10 Î¼M carbachol, compared with the Isc response elicited by forskolin alone (p<0.05) (fig 6). [4] At the concentrations used, both 8-Br-cAMP and carbachol caused only modest changes in Isc when added on their own (data not shown).
